1.description: First, add the switch to the designated area of the object, ensuring it is positioned for easy access and operation. This component is crucial as it serves as the primary control mechanism, allowing the user to turn the object on and off, thereby initiating its functionality.

2.description: Next, add the vertical support directly beneath the switch to provide stability and ensure that the switch is securely mounted. This vertical support is crucial as it reinforces the structure, preventing any wobbling or disconnection, and it serves as a foundational element for attaching additional components in subsequent steps.

3.description: Then, add the tube horizontally across the vertical support, ensuring it is securely fastened in place. This tube serves as a conduit for wiring and other components, providing essential pathways that connect the switch to the rest of the system while also stabilizing the vertical support by distributing weight evenly.

4.description: Now, add the mouth component to the front of the tube, ensuring it is securely positioned to facilitate airflow and output for the object. This addition is crucial as it not only enhances the functionality by providing a means for sound or air to escape but also visually integrates with the existing structure, connecting seamlessly with the vertical support and switch mechanisms.

5.description: Finally, add the other_leaf to the opposite side of the mouth, mirroring the first leaf and ensuring symmetrical functionality. This component not only balances the design aesthetically but also enhances the overall mechanism's efficiency by allowing for coordinated movement with the existing mouth part.
